channel.title: Item cache loading
channel.description:
Yea, this is kind of basic, just a short request on HOW to make NEW items load through the cache, instead of just setting them in class8.java.
OR - making class8.java hold more items, the switch statement part as i was told DOESNT work.

item.title: Item cache loading
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Kuchiki:

Get Tom’s cache editor?..

You do realise, it does not imput new models into the cache, im wanting to do like Miss Silabsoft did and imput NEW models into the cache and make NEW id’s for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Item cache loading
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Or make a dynamic item loader. Make a file what contains all the item info, like name, description, anInt174, etc, and than just make class8 parse all that info, and thats it. It’s really just that simple.

Read full topic

Get Tom’s cache editor?..

item.title: Item cache loading
item.dc:creator: @Reisyukaku Reisyukaku
item.description:
@Reisyukaku wrote:

well im kinda still new to all of this and i didnt think that the class 8 had a very small limit.

Read full topic

item.title: Item cache loading
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Reisyukaku:

why wont class8 hold alot? as long as your item/ npc/ object model number is between 8000 - 15000 then your client will be fine and your cache wont get destroyed. unless you plan on making over 7000 objects load then i see no problem.

Wow you don’t even understand what im posting for this. I don’t care about model numbers, and a class8.java will typically only hold around 120 custom items max. Meaning it is very limited. If i can make the items load through the cache, i can make it easier to add custom items, also get more quantity of them.

Read full topic
